website_summaries.verdict: An affordable and versatile pizza stone by a top brand that resists thermal shock better than some pricier options.
pros: Made of cordierite, a durable material that can be used on a grill
Owners love how quickly it heats up
Versatile 13-inch size is easier for some consumers to handle compared to larger stones
cons: Some reports of a strange odor that may fade with use
Some foods tend to stick on it

customer_reviews.title: Food will stick
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stone for it’s size on Prime Day. There was no smell to the stone but unlike pampered chief stones my pizza stuck on the stone. I did not know that you are suppose to use corn meal on the bottom of stone and pizza paddle to prevent sticking and the pizza should be made on a cool pizza paddle and transferred to the hot pizza stone that is already in the oven or grill. I wish it would have come with directions.
customer_reviews.author: E. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Polystyrene destroys our environment
customer_reviews.text: Product looks alright, haven’t used it yet, but I’m appalled by the packaging, don’t buy it, find another supplier. So much polystyrene, don’t these firms get it????
customer_reviews.author: Oxonthebox

customer_reviews.title: Please read this before purchasing!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our grill/smoker. We’ve used it a handful of times. Cons: I’m not sure why but any time we use it, it gives off a terrible odor (chemical smell) and gives our pizza a bad taste. I’ve tried to season it and it has not helped. Pros: solid and keeps the food hot but who wants to eat the food if it tastes terrible. Wish there were instructions on how to properly season or clean it. I’ve only used hot water to clean it. We gave it another try tonight and decided to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya H

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I was all excited to make my first homemade pizza ever. I bought the best pizza sauce form the Italian gourmet market, along with mozzarella that was freshly made right in front of me, and anchovies imported from Italy. Everything was going so well until the pizza was removed from the oven. Then the horror. The whole bottom of the pizza stuck to the stone. Totally ridiculous. I don't even know how to clean the thing, other than my Husky having a field day and getting the job done. Because of this bad experience, my pizza making days are one and done.
customer_reviews.author: MSK

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT size for RV ovens if a 14" stone is too big
customer_reviews.text: This is a bit smaller than standard pizza stones (most are 14"), which isPERFECT if you need this to fit in an RV oven. 14" stones are too big for most RV sized ovens by 3/4 inch. If your RV stove burns food on the bottom, and raw on top, you NEED this to dissapate/spread heat evenly. it fixed the problem INSTANTLY. Just place it on the bottom-most pan under the lower tray so burner heats this first and radiates up to food cooking. It just so happens this works well for pizza too, but it stays in our oven as a heat dissipator for ALL baking.
customer_reviews.author: VwgnTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Stinks like chemicals
customer_reviews.text: This pizza stone stinks like poisonous chemicals ... and the smell gets worse each time it's used. We missed our return window so it's going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Becky L Frusher

customer_reviews.title: Good fit for the RV oven
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order for a pizza stone. I ordered this one because the size fits my RV oven. The first one I ordered was square and too large for that oven so it is now in my house oven. I bought this round one as it is suppose to diffuse heat better in RV ovens that are noted for uneven heating. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: J. O. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this. Don't buy ANYTHING from Cuisinart. EVER.
customer_reviews.text: The set looks amazing! The lifter works well as does the cutter. HOWEVER: this stone gives off a chemical smell that is pungent! It stunk up my whole kitchen. And after if you put the stone on the cabinet it stinks up the area. It makes your food taste horrible. But that is not the worst thing. Cuisinart has THE. WORST. CUSTOMER. SERVICE. I have called. Emailed. Left messages. Never get a real person, they are always going to call within 12-24hrs. Never have.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S Frey

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Stone is so porous that everything sticks!
customer_reviews.text: I have Pampered Chef stones that are wonderful but needed a smaller stone for my toaster oven. I have tried everything, olive oil and cornmeal. I’ve tried heating stone for 15 minutes, I’ve tried directly from making pizza to putting it in the oven. I’ve ruined two pizzas so far. They stick to the stone and make a huge mess. It’s going in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Gisela Spires

customer_reviews.title: Good product has everything needed to make homemade pizza
customer_reviews.text: Very good pizza stone. Pizza steel folds up making it fit well in the cabinet.. Using Parchment paper makes it a very smooth transfer from peel to stone and back out again.. Using parchment paper also makes it easier to transfer to and from pizza stone..
customer_reviews.author: Andreas805

customer_reviews.title: Chintzey and not functionally designed
customer_reviews.text: The "Folding Pizza Peel" is not large enough to transfer the raw pizza onto the hot stone. Of course it should be 13" round instead of squared off on the sides. How does this happen you might wonder. Well, the product designer made it 13" round and it worked great. Then a Harvard MBA executive can in to add his value and said "we can square off the sides and save 25 cents per unit". Product designer objected and began to explain, but the Harvard MBA walked out of the room and barked "Just do it and make the pizza cutter cheaper too".
customer_reviews.author: T. Kocis

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged
customer_reviews.text: Received damaged with no visible damage to the box. Can I exchange? Or get a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad!
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality and the smell is awful. I tried washing it and the smell wouldn’t go away. It was cheap and I should have known it was too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: KellyL2182

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst pizza stone I've ever had. The food sticks to the stone and food has a strange taste. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Burris

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the reviews, brand name and coming in a bundle. It was a big mistake, for starters I did put a lot of flour on the peel yet my fresh dough stuck right on it. By the time I moved the pizza dough on to the stone it was already ruined. Then the dough stuck to the pizza stone even though stone was already pre warmed to temperature of 450c. I had to scrapped the pizza from the stone literally. Furthermore when cooking was completed the bottom of the crust remain soft. I never had those types problems with the previous pizza stones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but low quality
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to purchase this, my partner and I have been trying to perfect pizza at home forever. The stone unfortunately is Extremely difficult to clean and maintains every stain, food particle, or burn stain from the oven. Cleaning it is honestly a nightmare. The metal spatula that comes with the stone is unfortunately Very difficult to use as well. It’s hard to slide the pizza off the spatula for cooking. Even when using cornmeal or flour the dough tends to stick and not slide off easily making the pizza a mess. I have found it easier to just put the dough on the hot heated stone and build the pizza from there quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: The first time we used it the pizza stuck to the stone so bad but I didn't follow the instructions. The next time I made sure I had cornmeal and heated the stone to 450 and it worked perfectly! I have used it several times and the pizzas cook perfectly while sliding off easily when done. The pizza peel works perfectly and the pizza cutter is working great so far. I have only used it about 4 times so I don't know about the longevity but I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Narrington

customer_reviews.title: Great stone and peel
customer_reviews.text: Great stone and peel, and has made awesome pizzas on the grill. It turns your grill into a pizza oven and can cook a pizza in 5 minutes. THe package is great, but pizza cutter is a bit chintzy. Would rather have the pizza cutter removed and the stone made slightly bigger, and the folding pizza peel is great for storage.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Used the pizza stone twice, the first time on the grill and the second time in the oven. After following the directions for preparing the stone, on the grill the pizza stuck to the stone so that it was difficult to flip. The second time in the oven was even worse, the dough stuck to the grill so much that we have to chisel the pizza off the stone. Disgusted, the stone went into the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Ogilvie

customer_reviews.title: Find other Product...
customer_reviews.text: I follow WW and tried using my two-ingredient dough on this pizza stone in the oven...even with excess flour to help it be non-stick, it still stuck to both the transfer tray and stone. and didn't cook all the way through my thin dough...Then I couldn't get the melted cheese off the stone, even after I soaked it. So today, i thought i'd try using the stone but using foil between the pizza and the stone...did not cook all the way through. had to cook it on a normal cookie sheet...and the pizza cutter!!! total shit! Maybe this would work on a grill with more traditional dough, but for me it's going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Walker

customer_reviews.title: GREW MOLD!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one came with a peel, the other didn't. They are different colors for some reason. They both stained after first use but I figured that was inevitable. Then I noticed that there was green mold growing on one! I took it out of my cupboard to investigate further, and saw mold on the other one too! I washed both is boiling hot water and baking soda. Let them dry completely, then put them away. THEY GREW MOLD AGAIN. Very disappointing. And now I'm outside the return window. This product didn't even make a good pizza crust. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Dina S.

customer_reviews.title: Use this if you want your food to taste and smell like armpit.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, this thing stinks. I've tried to season it multiple times. Different types of oils, it doesn't matter.....the stone off gasses a horrendous smell. It smells up your house, and your food. I bought this as a less expensive replacement to a Pampered Chef stone that I broke. Bad choice.......I have relegated this to a bottom drawer and went back to the Pampered Chef pizza stones.....which are amazing.........
customer_reviews.author: EricB

customer_reviews.title: Save money on take out!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this stone.. got one for my mom for Mother’s Day, then bought one for myself after trying hers! She uses hers on the grill.. I use mine in the oven (500 degrees.. preheat stone in oven for at least 30 mins, then cook pizza for 13 mins). I put a piece of parchment paper on the shovel, sprinkle a little cornmeal on it, then put the pizza on the paper and transfer it that way into the oven (do NOT use parchment paper if using on the grill!). I’ve used this stone 2-3 times a week for the last 6 months and it is still going strong. I don’t even order pizza out anymore!
customer_reviews.author: JeMarieP

customer_reviews.title: Pizza stone grew mold!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one came with a peel, the other didn't. They are different colors for some reason. They both stained after first use but I figured that was inevitable. Then I noticed that there was green mold growing on one! I took it out of my cupboard to investigate further, and saw mold on the other one too! I washed both is boiling hot water and baking soda. Let them dry completely, then put them away. THEY GREW MOLD AGAIN. Very disappointing. And now I'm outside the return window. This product didn't even make a good pizza crust. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Dina S.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money. Pay a lil more for better quality
customer_reviews.text: Lol. This is what I get for buying cheap junk from a low-quality company. The pizza stone is fine. Does what it needs to do, which is heat up and not fall apart. The spatula is complete trash. Closes on me, can’t hold a pizza without folding in on itself, this led to a few pizzas falling on the floor and being wasted. Complete waste and utter disappointment. The cutter is also garbage. Broke after one use. I’ve learned my lesson from this company. I hope your experience is better than mine
customer_reviews.author: James McDonnough

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! My husband broke my pampered chief stone and I tried replacing it with this stone and there is no comparison. I will spend a few extra dollars and get a good stone. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: blkmom03

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This set is awesome! The pizza cutter is very sharp and cuts pizza like a charm. The stone gets very hot and gives the bottom of the pizza a great crust! The peel is very easy to use and the handle folds for easy storage. Such a great purchase. The only downside is that the pizza stone can stain but that is the case for all pizza stones to my knowledge. Its clean just slightly stained.
customer_reviews.author: Christon

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Genius in creating a Niche Product
customer_reviews.text: I am an outdoor grill guy with a variety of Pizza stones. I am reaching into very got open ovens to turn a pizza or need just another nudge to get things on or off a peel or stone. These are stupid simple genius spinners. They come as a pair and do what they need to. I used them the first time yesterday and they were perfect. My stone was at 750 degrees, my oven walls were around 700 and I have about 8" total height to work in. Went in at the 45's and could spin left right or life an edge and look. Perfect for the backyard pizza oven. thanks rch
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: Does not cook pizza
customer_reviews.text: The pizza stone itself is awful. I put the pizza stone in the oven while it was preheating in order to make the stone hot. I then placed my pizza on the stone and cooked it for the amount of time it said to on the box. The pizza was not cooked. It was soggy on the bottom and stuck to the pan. I tried multiple brands with this stone and it does this to every pizza.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Lessard

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: Don’t Bother with this product. Bought it a couple weeks ago. Last night used for the 1st time for pizza night with friends. My home still smells the next day. Odor that comes off is toxic everyone’s eyes instantly started to burn when I opened the oven to get one of the pizzas. I wish I could have a refund need to reach out to amazon. This was a true waist of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Pérez

customer_reviews.title: smoke will ruin your house
customer_reviews.text: Just an fyi, I seasoned this as directed repeatedly. It fills my home every time that I have tried to use it with super acidic smoke. I finally gave up and threw it away. I even watched YouTube videos attempting to fix the situation, it did not work. My house stinks for days horribly after I attempt to use it. DO NOT BUY...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was a WIN!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest thing since pizza sauce. Can I admit here that I'm lazy? We don't 'make' pizza ... we heat it up. This stone set is perfect for heating frozen or ready to cook pizza. I no longer get the pizza falling through the grill and the paddle ... AAAHMAZINGLY PERFECT for taking that baby out without sticking, sliding, or being pulled apart. I was actually surprised about how solid the included pizza cutter would be, it's a great feel as well, and cuts smooth without pulling or missing spots. All in all this was a WIN.
customer_reviews.author: Christian.glahn

customer_reviews.title: Absolute necessity
customer_reviews.text: These fill that gap in your ego, the one that tells your conscience that "I can just reach in there with a pair of channel locks, I don't need to buy some dumb fork on a stick" Well... ya do. The simplicity hurts my soul and leaves me wondering why I didn't invent this thing first!? But let me tell you... sometimes you just need to reach in the fire and tweak that pizza a bit. That's where these come in. The perfect simple solution. Spend the money; everyone knows you're too lazy to make them yourself "even though you could".
customer_reviews.author: Will Adams

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, basic pizza stone
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't in the market for an expensive pizza stone - I'm not sure what you get when you pay more? I have had a few of these (I keep dropping then and breaking them) and this one seems very good. It's a good size, although if you're planning to make an XL pizza, this probably isn't for you. It seems solid enough (don't drop it) and easy enough to clean. I recommend this if you're looking for a basic, affordable pizza stone.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia L

customer_reviews.title: Then the stone works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Seasoning is not necessary. Preheat to 450 to 500 degrees regardless of frozen pie directions. Use parchment paper or cornmeal to prevent sticking. Instructions are from Cuisine Customer Service. Then the stone works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C.

customer_reviews.title: Okay product if you only need to use it three times
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stone to use for making pizza, of course. We used it three times and on the third use it broke in hand while being removed from the oven. No reason that should have happened. Couldn't believe it! Guess we'll have to go back to Pampered Chef.
customer_reviews.author: Todd L

customer_reviews.title: Bad product pairing. Peel is laughably small
customer_reviews.text: My stone arrived cracked. However, even if it arrived intact I still would have returned. The handle on the peel is loose and not sturdy and the peel is comically small considering the size of the stone. Why would they pair a ~9” peel with a 13” stone? Unless to plan to make only small personal pizzas this will be useless.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: The shovel works great - the stone not so much.
customer_reviews.text: We are eating more frozen pizza these days and figured this would make it easier to cook them. The stone was disappointing as it seems to stop the heat from getting to the bottom of the pizza and it was not cooked properly. The shovel works great. Makes it so much easier t get the piping hot pizza out of the oven.
customer_reviews.author: UK2CA2SD

customer_reviews.title: It REEKS
customer_reviews.text: This thing emits the worst chemical smell I've ever smelled. I tried to season it with oil on my kamado, no change. It is horrible. If I die in the next few days its from smelling that death smoke. DO NOT BUY THIS THING!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this set! Made my first pizza using this pizza stone and it came out perfect! I thought it would be heavy but it’s not! I pre-heat the oven very high with the stone inside. I’m not skilled with using the pizza peel so I bake the pizza with parchment paper so it easily slides off the peel. I love how the peel handle folds for easy storage! Definitely recommend this product to my friends
customer_reviews.author: Shu

customer_reviews.title: Do exactly what they are supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: These do exactly what they are supposed to do and they do it well. I use these in an Uuni 2s pizza oven and I place one of these on each side of the outer crust and give the pizza a 1/4 - 1/2 turn. I can't believe someone said they are flimsy. Mine are far from flimsy. Maybe that guy is reviewing the wrong product.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Delivered Broken, Replacement Just Arrived
customer_reviews.text: Pizza stone was needed, and the 13" round seemed perfect. But it arrived cracked in half. Contacted for return/replace and just waiting for new, unbroken one to arrive. This this will be just what I need when I can use it. Local stores have pre-made pizza dough balls, and I have tried one and they are great. Can't wait to really work it in as a week night option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: item not what pictured.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased thinkin I would be getting what seemed like a large pizza stone and the slide to actually hold the size of the pizza. I can't even move the pizza to the oven. The pizza doesn't even fit on it. You have to make a tiny pizza for it to work. Also, I asked to return it, apparently I just missed it by 1 day. I did just open the box. Anyway don't buy it it isn't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The first time try, it works!
customer_reviews.text: I used it first time today. After reading negative reviews, I am afraid to bake my own pizza. However, my pizza did not stick on the stone. What I did was preheat the oven with the stone for 1hour and pour enough corn meal under the dough to make it slide me and transferable to the pizza stone. Bake for 10min. It won’t stick on the pizza stone. I also did not smell the chemicals at the first time use. I will check it after serval times usage. The pizza stone do not need preseansoning which will make a lot of smoke From the oil because of such high temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Lotty

customer_reviews.title: Great Combo Set
customer_reviews.text: I use this exclusively on my grill. First time around I made the mistake of not using corn meal on the bottom of my pizza. It totally screwed up my pizza experience because i couldn't get the pizza off the peel. That was TOTALLY my fault. I ended up burning ingredients on the pizza stone. I was able to clean them off and reuse it again and the flavor was still great!. Cant recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: although well built it was super small. I have it away
customer_reviews.text: Pizza cutter is cheap feeling. I threw it out. Pizza pan.. although well built it was super small. I have it away. The stone, works well but also to small.. the only size pizza you can add on that is a 10" size as it falls off the edge. But.. it fits perfectly in my BBQ. So that's where that went.
customer_reviews.author: Df186

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: There work great for spinning pizzas on my converted Weber kettle. It may just be my dough, but if I stab the from the top to spin it tears and doesn't work that well. But I figured out that if I use them on the side of the dough parallel to the stop and sort of pinch the outside and push and pull the crust around it works great..... yeah I know that probably makes no sense and is really hard to visualize.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: A pizza cutter should cut pizza, right?
customer_reviews.text: The item I wanted most from the kit was the pizza cutter. Well, it sucks. I have to run it back and forth many many times while applying great pressure in order for it to sort of slice the pizza, and then I still have to pull the pizza apart along the lines I attempted to cut, which makes for a messy slice. Other than that, the stone is also ridiculously hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: C Stew

customer_reviews.title: The description is a lie; it is a 13 inch stone
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pretty nice product but I purchased it to use in my new Cuisinart TOA-65 AirFryer. It’s is advertised as a 12” stone and my new oven has a 12” cooking space. The 12” inch stone does not measure 12 inches, it measures 13 inches which makes it totally worthless for use in my Cuisinart TOA-65 AirFryer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to heat up and everything sticks to it
customer_reviews.text: Takes forever to heat up and everything sticks to it regardless of the amount of flour you put beneath the pizza. Stains do not come out...ever. The material is very porous. The two other utensils that come with the pizza plate are good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dull edge arrived dented, but it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I was less than satisfied upon opening the package to find the blade already dented in two places on one side, but what really surprised me was how dull the blade is out of the box. It's actually flat, though thin enough that it cuts "enough." The good news is that blade and damage can be sharpened and grinded, which is probably what I'll end up doing in lieu of returning it. That said, quality out of the box is lacking, especially for Cuisinart, and packaging could be better to prevent damage in transit.
customer_reviews.author: Johaan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible smell.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few weeks back and a replacement for one that we had that broke. We finally used it and it gave off such a bad oder that it became nauseating for everyone in the house. I thought maybe it was the oven so I cleaned it then heated it up it was fine then I put the pizza stone back in and shortly after the smell returned, I pulled the stone back out and put it on the back porch I don't know what kind of chemicals are in it but it can't be good for us. Money down the drain won't be using it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Seinan F.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Our first pizza stone. What a difference using this pizza stone has made to the taste of the crust. It fits perfectly into the oven at 12 inches. It makes personal sized pizzas perfectly. The pizza peel makes it easy to turn the pizza. We use parchment paper to help get the pizza to the stone then after about 4 minutes pull the paper out. I recommend this product, especially for a beginner like us. It gets you started for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price for just the pizza stone alone. It heats evenly and from the very first use i got a very crispy golden brown crust. The pizza peal works great and makes transferring the pizza onto and off of the stone so much easier! The cutter is a tad flimsy feeling so ill probably reserve that for using on raw doughs and pastry work.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah GG

customer_reviews.title: Detective
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been disappointed this much with amazon’s choice. I was so lucky that I had two pizza pan...this one isnt non stick & it ruined my whole pizza. It takes me an hour to be able clean the pan...Dont buy it at all...Cuisin Art is one of my to go brand that why i didn’t go through every single survey that customer wrote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: spinners are great.  haven’t used the either stuff.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re only interested in the spinners, they are great. i have a weber grill with a pizza stone and kettlepizza (highly recommended btw), and it’s a lot easier to rotate the pizza with these guys. totally worth it, i’d buy them again in a heartbeat. although if you’re handy i’m sure you could fabricate something very similar.
customer_reviews.author: acosmichippo

customer_reviews.title: dull - save yourself the time
customer_reviews.text: It was very, very dull...I sent it back. The cutting edge was flat about as wide as the back side of a good size kitchen knife. Not sure if this one skipped a step or they are all like that?
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t believe it would stink up the house
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before buying this product and figured maybe the reason for the chemical smell was improper use, so I bought it myself. It does smell horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Rue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I use these (one of hem) to grab the far side of the pizza and turn it. For my first turn I use one of them and lift the pizza up with a peel to turn. Once I get better I may be able to not use the peel and turn with both. It's a matter of getting the pizza cooked enough before it needs to be turned so these don't tear the crust.
customer_reviews.author: Don Jr

customer_reviews.title: Cute and convienient pizza set!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner at pizza making and this set makes it fun and convenient! Makes you want to use it more and more. Almost all you need to get started! I would recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: MetroShopper

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to get the Pizza off
customer_reviews.text: We must be missing some trick to season this properly because the pizza will not come off. We have to soak it for days and scrub and chip away. The same dough comes off other pans fine. If someone can tell me what we are doing wrong I am happy to change this review.
customer_reviews.author: Ora R Sheinson

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Mine was NOT glazed nor was it cured. It smells badly like chemicals. I used it to bake some cookies. They stained the stone and was hard to scrape off. Its b.s that you are not supposed to wash it. There are no instructions on its use. Do not buy this. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great utility stone
customer_reviews.text: This is a great utility Stone. I’m using this for sourdough loaves and the stone gives the bread an even bottom crust. I’m looking forward to using it for pizza. It does seem thinner than other pizza stones, and is advertised with accurate specs. Loving this for baking because I’m able to move the loaf from convection to conventional without shifting the loaf. Great product & arrived in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: AliciaWatson

customer_reviews.title: Makes it so much easier to make pizza at home!
customer_reviews.text: I never had a pizza stone before. Making pizza on a sheet pan or directly on the oven rack is just not the same! I enjoy making pizza for my family and they enjoy eating it. Be sure to heat the stone before putting the raw dough on it. One thing - pizza making is messy! The flour -or corn meal - whatever you choose, used to make it easier to move the pizza around -makes a big mess.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Blue Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite purchases ever! For the price you can’t lose just getting a stone at this price- BUT you get the pizza cutter which is amazing AND the pizza tray/grabber thing! It fold for storage and is great! Fits a normal size pizza and really cuts down on burns lol
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible chemical fumes and odor upon first time in oven
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this. The first time I put it in the oven, my apartment filled with chemical fumes (not smoke) that burned my eyes, caused them to get red and watery, and burned my throat. I had to leave my apartment to get relief and keep my windows open and fan running all day to try to dissipate the fumes. The odor was intense and caustic. Would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: KRG424

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little set to make pizzas with the kids, it’s not a full size stone, but is sturdy and really works well. The paddle folds up nicely and seems well made. The actual pizza slicer is about as good as a dollar store cutter, but works fine. I recommend this stone, you can really taste the difference in the crust.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Viscuso

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. After one use, it’s impossible to clean. It comes with no instructions. The pizza peel is smaller than the stone and very sticky. The Stone was not smelly but the stains don’t come off. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: This stone is good I’ve read some negative reviews but I decided to give it a go. I leave mine in the oven unless I need to cook something because I’d say it would break easily but for cooking the buzz’s it’s great the peel is decent quality too. I’d say I’ve used it 15-20 times so far and had no issues
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran Loye

customer_reviews.title: The stone started to smoke and stink on second use - despite being clean - was unusable
customer_reviews.text: The first use this was fine - we used it as instructed. It was cleaned with water and fully tried but on second use started to smoke and give off a terrible smell. Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Malibu Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Returning - will not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I have baked on stones for years. This stone was advertised as one you can bake and grill on. When my last stone broke I purchased this one. Our entire house welled up with smoke and it stunk highly of chemicals. The peel was nice. The pizza cutter was of very poor quality. I am returning the stone because the smell that came out was horrific. It lasted in our house for several days and you could taste it on the pizza we made. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: tom mead

customer_reviews.title: Knife is not nearly sharp enough
customer_reviews.text: I am not able to easily cut through a thin crispy crust w this knife. I’d have expected much more from a Cuisinart product
customer_reviews.author: Levi's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love My Pizza Grilling Set
customer_reviews.text: I love pizza, and now I love making it. The Cuisinart CPS-445 Pizza Grilling Set is simply put... awesome. You place the stone in the oven and let it heat up while you prepare the pizza, once hot, you place your epicurius delight on the hot stone and prego your pizza is now cooking on both sides... it is like having a fire baking oven in your own kitchen... almost. Pros: - easy to use - easy to clean Cons: I haven't found any, so far. Will update review if I do. Overall buy it and enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Santos

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set
customer_reviews.text: This set is Perfect! I couldn't get over the tremendous value. I purchased this for my daughter so she can have pizza night with her family the authentic way. Aside from the recipe ingredients, this is everything she needs. This entire set cost me less than what I paid for just my stone. I'm about to buy another as a backup since it is such a great value! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Michele O'Toole

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pizza stone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pizza stone, cheap for one made of cordierite. It is 3/8" thick, not 3/4", which actually is better most of the time. The wierd part is Cuisinart website also says 3/4".
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Good first pizza stone for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was my first pizza stone, I did do a lot of reading the reviews before I decided to purchase one. It does put off an odor but I kept my exhaust fan on. Our pizza turned out awesome and I am very glad I purchased this for the price it was reasonable for my first one.
customer_reviews.author: TriciaS

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: works like a charm... great product and makes terrific crispy pizza. I use it for a cauliflower pizza crust and it makes a tremendous difference.
customer_reviews.author: Fifty shades of annoyed

customer_reviews.title: Very bad stone, not a stone actually.
customer_reviews.text: Very very bad stone. It is actually not a stone at all, looks like back if a tile. Everything sticks to it no matter what and cannot be cleaned. Very bad product. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: LAGirl

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Great stones that carry heat very well. Bought two, one for pizza and one for bread. Glad I did. These are a pain to clean. They are super absorbent. I've tried everything to clean the pizza stone one I use but it's just not going to get clean.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Not bad . The pizza cutter is not very sturdy at all. The pizza stone is kind of thin and the pizza shovel is good. Not a high end product but for the occasional homemade pizza probably not a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: stogie

customer_reviews.title: Peel is too narrow. Stone broke during first use.
customer_reviews.text: So this ended up being a huge disappointment. The pizza peel isn't wide enough to transfer a pizza the size of the stone. The stone also cracked in half in my oven under high heat conditions. Keep looking. I am again now.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Make excellent pizza but on the smaller size
customer_reviews.text: For those who like costco sized pizzas, you'll need something else if you don't want the pizza hanging over the edge. Other than that, it is exactly what you need. One thing to note is that the spatula will snap down depending on the angle you hold it, I've almost cut/smashed my fingers multiple times and just waiting for the inevitable. Definitely make the conscious effort not to hold it the wrong way or you will hurt yourself. The counter to this though, is that it's ability to fold makes it very easy to store in a drawer if need be.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Must Have if you use Kette Pizza!
customer_reviews.text: I have Kettlepizza unit that I make pizzas on that require you to turn the pizzas after a certain amount of time..I always used the pizza peel to shake the pizza to turn..Than I bought these..and its a game changer for me..A must have for anyone that has Kettlepizza type attachment
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdily made pizza knife. High quality materials. The handle makes it easy to grip. I really like that the blade isn’t ‘knife sharp’. I guess a blade guard really isn’t needed but I would like to have one anyway.
customer_reviews.author: 3DayPriest

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful when handling this product
customer_reviews.text: This item was just received and VERY dis satisfied that the blade does not come with a protector or guard. If it was dropped it could be a very nasty cut or loss of finger or toe. It would be safer to use a standard pizza cutting wheel from the Dollar Tree.
customer_reviews.author: DRC

customer_reviews.title: This was not as advertised a damaged box - the peel has a big bend requiring a deep discount
customer_reviews.text: It should have been substantially discounted as there is a significant bend in the steel of the peel. See the pictures. This should have listed as not very good but the peels is significantly damaged and should have been not just a $1.50 cheaper but at least half price. and labeled as peel is damaged The stone and the pizza wheel are both in good shape. Jmjones
customer_reviews.author: jmjones

customer_reviews.title: No no no
customer_reviews.text: Put off a horrible chemical smell that permeated the pizza. Tried to rinse it with water and let it dry for weeks. Tried again with cookies and same thing. Tried "burning" them smell off at 400 degrees made the whole house smell nauseating. Had to open all doors and air it off. Smelt like burnt plastic maybe? I dont know, but not a smell I want to continue to inhale.
customer_reviews.author: Starla O.

customer_reviews.title: Dough would stic onto the stone and leave stains
customer_reviews.text: I used it in the oven and the dough stick onto the stone. The stains from the burned dough wouldn’t come off after soaking and scrubbing. It only works well if I put the dough on cookie paper. It’s my first pizza stone so I don’t know how it compares with others but definitely would be a mess without the cookie paper
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Dull as a door knob.
customer_reviews.text: The size and weight of this product is fine, but the cutting ability out of the box is very poor. Nevermind, hers comes Big G to the rescue. I have spent a lot of time grinding and honing the blade, and now it works well, not great but well.
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with this item. I can't tell a difference in my crust cooking it on the pizza stone. The pizza cutter and spatula are very cheap. I was so disappointed in this waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: SKIP IT
customer_reviews.text: don't buy this. I threw mine in the trash after a couple usages since I cant return it. your pizzas will get stuck no matter WHAT YOU TRY!!
customer_reviews.author: mrsb

customer_reviews.title: I never even thought these existed
customer_reviews.text: I never even thought these existed. Now I just love them. Everyone in the family loves making homemade pizza, it's now becoming one of our things to do. The spinners are just great to make sure you get a great crisp on the crust, not a burn. Work great.
customer_reviews.author: Dubelsa Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like left over Pizza that tastes fresh
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered one of these a long time ago. Nothing like left over Pizza that tastes fresh.
customer_reviews.author: joAnne

customer_reviews.title: Needs to have cleaning instructions
customer_reviews.text: Baking bread on the hot stone makes the bottom stick and it gets so baked that it takes an hour of soap and scrubbing to remove the bottom crust. You have to cut the bread from the stone! Instructions on baking bread or pizza is needed. How to prepare the stone for use and then, how to clean the stone after use.
customer_reviews.author: Customer1234

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is not like any pizza stone I have ever had. It absorbs the food and don't dare cut on it.
customer_reviews.author: charli

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Cuisinart brand.  Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Cutter is flimsy. Peel is too small to transfer raw dough to the grill. Stone was rough, cut myself washing it as there was a sharp piece of the stone that caught my finger. Not impressed with this cuisinart product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dana s

customer_reviews.title: worst purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love cuisinart. There products are usually awesome. This pizza stone was horrid. It burned and didn't cook my first pizza, then it boke in half on second use. Discusting and had to go to the detist for broken teeth. what a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Food stuck on it
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a gift and it came with a mangled box and FOOD stuck to it.
customer_reviews.author: amart

customer_reviews.title: Stone is ok, pizza peel is garbage
customer_reviews.text: The stone is ok, but the pizza peel is just trash. First of all, it's tiny compared to the stone, meaning that you can only make very small pizza. Second, the handle is foldable but doesn't lock in place very well and makes the whole thing feel very cheap. Returning mine, I got tricked by the famous brand but this item it's just bad.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Makes pizza spinning easy
customer_reviews.text: I used these yesterday to turn the pizzas on the stone inside my bbq pizza oven. They are a great tool for turning pizzas for even cooking, without having to remove the pizza from the pizza oven. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JK

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CPS-013 Alfrescamore Pizza Grilling Stone
product_meta.description: Color:Pizza Grilling StoneGrill pizza evenly and easily with The Cuisinart Pizza Grilling Stone. You will be able to cook your pizzas evenly on the grill with this 3/4" thick cordierite stone. At 13", this pizza stone will allow you to make a variety of different size pizzas. You can use this stone whether you want to make a pizza for the whole family or your own personal pie. Cordierite is the perfect material for the grill because it withstands the high temperatures of an open flame and resists thermal shock better than ceramic. Be the hit at your next tailgate with this pizza stone as you grill perfect pizzas for all your friends and family.
feature_bullets: 13" DIAMETER: At 13", this pizza stone will allow you to make a variety of different size pizzas. You can use this stone whether you want to make a pizza for the whole family or your own personal pie.
CORDIERITE STONE COMPOSITION: Cordierite is a durable stone-like material that will not crack in extreme heat or cold, and resists thermal shock and high heat better than ceramic.
PERFECT FOR ANY BAKED GOOD: Besides baking pizza, the grilling stone is perfect for baking calzones, breads, and desserts.
PERFECT FOR ANY GRILL: The 13” diameter makes it a perfect fit for almost all grills. The grilling stone can be used in almost every oven as well.

HEATS UP QUICKLY AND COOKS EVENLY: The stone heats evenly and cooks the pizza from the bottom up. Simply heat the stone for fifteen minutes before placing a fresh pizza on it and you’ll end up with a delicious and perfectly cooked pizza.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,249 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
